Set this as current home point?Yes.No.1�
Arrrg, so you're the landlubbin' adventurer that they sent from Bastok.1�
I'm a busy man, so let's cut with the chitchat and get right down to business.1�
Lately, you adventurers are making quite a killin' on items, weapons, and the like. We knew that you were out there, but we didn't think you'd be givin' us this much competition.1�
But rather than gettin' in each other's way, I thought that there might be a way we could work together. What I want ya t'do is give me an idea of what you adventurers are capable of.1�
There are a few items that me mateys couldn't acquire. I want ya t'go and get them.1�
Travel to one of them molten lava falls in Ifrit's Cauldron.1�
If you throw in  $����, a monster will appear. Bring back the #���� that the beast has on it.1�
Do ya think you can handle it, ya landlubber?1�
Hah hah hah! Me landlubbin' adventurer brought back  $����. It looks like I need to find myself some new mateys! Hah hah hah!1�
I guess this means you've completed your mission. Now let me write you somethin' you can take back to...1�
Arrrg, why if it ain't little Ayaya. Ya get prettier every time I sees ya.1�
Gilgamesh. It was fine when you called me that when I was a child, but I'm twenty years old now.1�
So, what brings ya t'these here parts? Come to check up on your adventurer?1�
That is one of the reasons. We wouldn't want you snatching up one of Bastok's best.1�
If I wanted to snatch up Bastok's best, I'd be snatching up the fine samurai standing in front of me. How about it, Ayaya? Leave that boring job of yours and join us!1�
We'd love t'have you. You'd have the chance t'wield your blade whenever you please, not when that president says you can. Arrrg, what d'ya say?1�
While I am flattered by your offer, I am satisfied with, and hold pride in, my current post.1�
I realize that I still have much to learn, but at the same time I feel that I must travel the roads I see fit to travel.1�
Swords and muskets are not made to be drawn. That is what my parents taught me, and those are the words I wish to live by.1�
Ayaya...1�
I have brought with me a document from the president himself. It covers the treatment of Bastokan adventurers, as well as overseas trade guidelines.1�
You may want to read over the details at a later time. You need not give an answer now. However, I trust that Norg will take steps in the right direction.1�
Arrrg, ya don't leave much room fer choice now, do you?1�
I'll take that as a compliment. I learned everything I needed to know from the years I spent here in training.1�
Okay, okay. You go back and tell the old president I said hello.Oh, and don't ya forget t'talk to Ryoma before you leave. It's the least ya could do fer him.1�
I'm sorry, but that will have to wait until another day... However, maybe next time I will bring along my younger sister.1�
Your assignment in Norg is complete. You may return to Bastok now, and do not forget to report to Naji upon your arrival.1�

Open the door?Yes.No.1�
Hold it right there, buddy. This ain't no caf�i. What business do you have here?1�
You finally made it,  .1�
Lion!1�
You don't have to worry about  . �[He's/She's] okay.Anyway, I thought you guys welcomed adventurers.1�
Understood.1�
Well, for starters, I should welcome you to Norg.1�
However, as much as I'd like to sit down and talk about old times over a bottle of 813 Rolanberry, we must first face our new problem with Kam'lanaut.1�
You mean you don't remember what happened at Castle Zvahl?1�
It all began with a stone, or so the legend says.1�
In ages past, a sentient jewel, enormous and beautiful, banished the darkness. Its many-colored light filled the world with life and brought forth mighty gods.1�
Bathed in that light, the world entered an age of bliss until, after a time, the gods fell into slumber. That world was called Vana'diel.1�
The legend goes on to say...From the darkest depths of the earth the Warriors of the Crystal rose...1�
Do you remember?1�
Yes... I do now.1�
Raogrimm, it is good to have you back. How has all this come to be?1�
As you know, I was the Talekeeper of the Galka--the keeper of our race's memories. But there was so much pain, so much anger...1�
I let myself become trapped in a dark abyss of swirling rage and madness...1�
Raogrimm...1�
People are capable of kindness beyond angels, yet we also commit sins that would put a demon to shame...1�
We all stand precariously on the edge between darkness and light... And when we fall, we are greeted by only madness and chaos.1�
And so I have fallen...1�
I don't know. It could have used a little more excitement.1�
The Galka can never do anything right.1�
The Archduke of Jeuno and... What are you two doing here!?1�
We come to reap the seeds that we have sown.4�
You've performed your duty well, as ignorant as you are.4�
I can see that we still have a little more cleaning up to do, but that won't be a problem.1�
Eternal paradise. The land of the gods. The dream we Zilart have held on to for ten thousand years is about to become a reality.1�
Zilart? You... You can't be! That civilization perished thousands of years ago!1�
The great bane will devour the fair land of Vana'diel.1�
The ancient seal will be broken, awakening nightmares of ages past.1�
The blood of innocents will soak the earth, and the world will fall into fear and despair.1�
Hah! Galka, Humes, beastmen--no life on this planet has any purpose or meaning.1�
Like I told you before, we will not be handing over Vana'diel to anyone. This is our world.1�
Yes, I am no longer sensing the impurities that were blocking the power that lies deep within Vana'diel. The ��noise�� has gone.1�
Simply defeating ��him�� twenty years ago did not silence the noise.4�
We ran into a snag. We were unable to release him from the crystal with our power alone.1�
However, with the Talekeeper, we had what we needed. But there is no need to go into the details of that here.1�
I can hear them approaching...Minions of the Crystal.1�
But as one bright star shines through the clouds at night...1�
And as one song rings clear above the roar of beasts...1�
We hold to one hope in these darkest of times.1�
This world is nothing but a grave, and you are the maggots that squirm through the rotting corpse.1�
It is time we put an end to Vana'diel as it is now.1�
Hear us! We sing the song of hope...and your requiem! 4�
That they will come, with the wisdom of ages and the strength of thousands, to deliver us from our plight.1�
We await the awakening of the Warriors of the Crystal.1�
Oh, no you don't!4�
Arrrg, make sure ya stop by Kazham and visit the Chieftainness, Jakoh Wahcondalo, before heading off t'the Temple of Uggalepih.1�
If ya tell her I sent ya, she should give ya some help. Now get a move on! There's no time t'lose.1�
So we needs 6���� to get deeper into the temple... Even I don't know what lurks down there.1�
I can see potential in you,  , but don't go doin' anything stupid now. We want to sees you back 'ere in one piece!1�
Seven stone monuments? Arrrg, me thinks me saw one in the Yuhtunga or Yhoator Jungle. Can't remember which one, though...1�
And that be all me knows. Maybe ya saw one o' 'em durin' a mission ya went on. Try t'remember. If ya can't, ya can always ask yer adventurin' mateys.1�
I'm sorry that I have no more t'tell ya. If that old bat in the temple hadn't been so secretive...1�
We here at Norg sometimes do business in and around the Sanctuary of Zi'Tah. One big forest, that place is.1�
No, it ain't nothin' like the jungles around here, but it sure be full of surprises. Don't go gettin' caught up in the scenery, or ya may find yourself lost!1�
Arrrg! You've gathered all the jewels! You'd make a mighty fine pirate. No wonder me daughter likes ya. Now all ya have t'do is take those to the ancient temple on Zepwell Island.1�
You'll find Zepwell Island off the southwest tip of Quon. What, you say that's where you found one of the stone monuments? Well, then ya don't need me directions now, do ya?1�
Delkfutt's Tower?I jus' got some information 'bout Verena. If that piece of info is correct, then that tower is where Verena has been taken!1�
And t'make things worse, our Zilart friends from Jeuno seem t'be involved. I've already sent some of me mateys t'help Aldo, but I have a bad feelin' about this. Hurry t'Qufim!1�
A thief like her won't be easy t'find. I'll have me mateys around Vana'diel spread the word that yer lookin' fer a crystal like the one she has.1�
If she gets wind of that info, that Maree's likely t'settle down until ya find her. We can only pray that what she has is what we need.1�
Arrrg, so that be the 3���� that we've been searchin' fer. It looks like you had a hell of a time tryin' t'get yer hands on it.1�
But the real hell is yet t'come,  . Crystal Warriors...floating islands... It may all seem crazy, but don't let that get in yer way. Yer Vana'diel's only hope.1�
We can't know when Eald'narche will attempt t'open the gate. It could be t'morrow, fer all I know. If ya have any preparations, I'd suggest makin' 'em now.1�
Arrrg, the Zilarrrt's dream of Paradise may be over, but that doesn't change the fact that them beastmen still be crawlin' over the face of Vana'diel.1�
When ya think about it, this little charade with the princes may've just been the tip of the blimey iceberg.1�
And Lion... I haven't told the other scallywags what really happened t'her. They all think she's off on some adventure...1�

It's always easier t'forget about the things that trouble ya. That be why people always forget those who pass away. I don't want that happenin' t'me daughter. That's why she'll always be alive here in Norg.1�
Arrg, be good to see ya!So you and yer friends were the landlubbers what saved her, eh?1�
Don't ya worry none, she be sleepin' it off like a sailor that's too fond of Opo-opo brew. The whole ordeal's left me girl a bit under the weather, but she'll pull through.1�
Hasn't stopped her talkin' me ears off, o'course. Can't get a word in edgewise.1�
...I jus' be glad that me girl ain't forgotten about me.1�
Even after walkin' the plank into the great beyond, she still remembers her old man.1�
She may not be me daughter by blood, but she's still the apple of me eye. I do believe a reward be due you.1�
Ya can have the pick of one of me treasures. I'll be givin' whatever's left to yer mates what helped ya.1�
Blimey. Are ya tryin' t'tell me that the savior of the world can't make up �[his/her] mind about a simple thing like this? Guess some things never change, eh?1�
But who be I t'judge?Let me know when you've made yer decision.Jus' don't complain if all the best loot be taken!1�

Still, we seem t' both be steerin' ourrr ships t'wards the same ��X�� on the proverbial treasure map fer the time bein'...Yet seein' how our plans be wide as the horiz'n, we best not turn a patched eye to these problems.1�

Keep this infermation below deck, if ye catch me drift. The situation be bad enough without the entire continent up in arms.In any case, I'll make sure t' apprrrise ye of any new developments if I get wind of 'em. Ye can count on that--cross me own plank and hope t' fly, stick a pegleg on me thigh.1�
The westerly winds bring wit' 'em tales of destruction from the Near East as well.1�

Ye be the ballast that keeps Vana'diel upright,  , and the realm needs ye now mor'n ever. This may not be worth a grain of salt, comin' from an old sailor tucked safely away in his captain's quarters, but don't go overboard wit' the heroics.1�
We made Norg our headquarters about thirty years ago.1�
The Crystal War and the unification of countries...all this was unthinkable back then.1�
They were hard times, but no one had their complaints.1�
On the northern tip of Mindartia is a wild, untamed region called the Sanctuary of Zi'Tah. In this area there remains a set of ancient ruins.1�
I remember those ruins being referred to as Ro'Maeve.1�
Gah-hah-hah! You're probably wonderin' what the hell an auction house's doin' down here in these damn caves. We're pirates, whaddaya expect?1�
Welcome t'Norg. Feel free t'have a look about our headquarters.1�
For guys like us that live on the sea, you adventurers sure come in handy. You're our only source of info from the mainland.1�
But once you head out into the wide open sea...now that's our territory. If we get your ship in our sights, there's no escapin'. We may be friends today, but who knows about tomorrow?1�
Go right on in. The boss is waitin' for ya.1�
Hello, �[sir/ma'am]. My name is Rafid, but that's all I remember about my past. I came here a year ago when my ship was attacked and I was rescued by the pirates.1�
Hold on there, �[buddy/lady]. Nobody, not even adventurers, is allowed through here.1�
Aye, I be hearin' all about ya. If yer done here in Norg, then take a ship t' wherever ya want.1�
Set sail for where?Selbina.Mhaura.Nowhere.1�
I'll be here if ya change yer mind.1�
'Twasn't so long ago that I'd say ya were spewing brine if ya told me an adventurer wanted to use our ships. But the times, they be a-changin'.1�
Unlike armor, the strength of a weapon depends solely on the skill of its owner. Just because one's blade is sharp doesn't mean one can wield it to its full potential.1�
But an adventurer such as yourself would have already known that...1�
So, you need  $����. I see Master Jaucribaix is starting another project. Let me tell you where to find that item.1�

You won't just find one lying around anywhere. Forging a katana is somewhat of a ritual. The smith focuses all his spiritual energy into the task. Thus, the #���� used must be from a spiritual place as well.1�
Beyond the Meriphataud Mountains is an ancient forest known as the Sanctuary of Zi'Tah. There you will find a tree that has been standing for over a thousand years.1�
Only a branch from this tree is suitable for the flame that burns in Master Jaucribaix's furnace. However, take care when traveling in Zi'Tah, as it is a land of much mystery and danger.1�
Here, take this #����. You will know what to do with it when you arrive at the tree. Take care not to lose it, as it is a very rare item.1�

If you want me to give you another #����, bring me one #���� and two %����, and I will think about it.1�
What? You need another #����? And after I told you how important it was! If you want me to give you another one, bring me one #���� and two %����, and I will think about it.1�
I do not mean to sound rude, but this is a very important item. Do not go losing it again.1�
Welcome back from your journey. Please deliver that #���� directly to Master Jaucribaix.1�
Well, if it isn't my favorite adventurer. How is your training coming along? I can see that you have become quite the samurai.1�
But small talk is not why you have come to me, is it? It is a shame that your #���� has met such a regrettable fate.1�
However, you need not worry. The one place where you can obtain  $���� is here in Norg.1�
Like a salmon returns to its birthplace to die, all %���� that are disposed of by their owners make their way back here to Norg. The blade you disposed of is not an exception.1�
I do not know what reasons you had when disposing of your #����, but the moment that blade left your possession, it became ours once again.1�

I can return it to you if you wish, but it will cost you. Pay me 
 gil, and I will give back to you what you once let slip through your hands.1�
The destiny that lies ahead of that #���� is much more important than you could ever imagine. Take care of it this time.1�
Deep within the Sea Serpent Grotto, the Sahagin have built a special door that can only be opened with  $����.1�
Ya say ya want  $����? Ha! Why don't ya try askin' one of the lil' devils?1�
You ever heard of those lantern-swingin', knife-wieldin' Tonberries? Travel to the old temple in the Yhoator Jungle and you'll get your fill of the little beasts.1�
My name is Jaucribaix, and I am the blacksmith here in Norg. I don't waste my time with that crystal synthesis rubbish. I forge all my katana in the traditional manner.1�
Ah, have you reconsidered my offer?1�
Our leader, Gilgamesh, has asked me to forge him a katana, but I am in somewhat of a bind.1�
A katana is a work of art. I refuse to replace the traditional methods of smithing with modern synthesis. However, my supply of materials is currently running low.1�
If these items were easy to come by, I would go myself. Unfortunately, this is not the case, and I require your assistance.1�
Listen to Jaucribaix's request?Yes.No.1�
I see.I apologize for taking up your valuable time.1�
I am grateful for your assistance. Would you be so kind as to fetch me  $���� and  $����?1�
The #���� is for the flame that fuels my furnace, and the #���� is the perfect material for melting the iron. Both are needed to forge a true katana blade.1�
To learn of where you may come across these items, ask my pupils.1�

Tell them I sent you, and they will assist you with your preparations for the journey. Also, if you come across any trouble, you may ask them for further aid. However, I doubt you will require it.1�
To learn of where you may come across the items I wish you to bring me, ask my pupils.1�

Tell them I sent you, and they will assist you with your preparations for the journey. Also, if you come across any trouble, you may ask them for further aid. However, I doubt you will require it.1�
When you have gathered the two items, bring them directly to me and I will begin my work.1�
Wonderful. These are the materials that I require. I apologize, but I must hurry or Gilgamesh will have my head. I will reward you for your services when I have finished the katana.1�
How long will it take, you ask? A good blade takes at least three full days to complete. Come to me then. You need not worry. I will be right here.1�
Again, I apologize for not being able to give you your reward sooner.1�

My work is not yet complete. I still require 
� ��[more hour/more hours]. It is not wise to waste your time trying to outrun the clock in this game we call life.1�
Time is like a flowing river--it cannot be sped up or slowed down. We must float along at the pace it has chosen.1�
Ah,  , you have finally returned. I was beginning to worry that you had forgotten about your reward.1�
Now where did I put that...1�
Arrrg, if it isn't our little helper �[boy/girl]!1�
Gilgamesh.1�
Ya did some mighty fine work in gettin' me matey, Jauc, his materials. Thanks t'you, I got meself a fine new blade.1�
Listen carefully,  . Within a katana, the soul of its maker and the soul of its wielder are intertwined.1�

That newfangled crystal synthesis you adventurers be usin' is all fine fer mantles and arrows, but it can't copy the traditional methods. One must know the essentials behind a blade if they ever want t'master it.1�
That's why we make adventurers like you go on quests like that last one. We want you t'know the true meanin' of wieldin' a blade like this.1�
Know the meaning of the power you hold, and only then will you find the true power within. That be ��bushido,�� the way of the samurai.1�
